description:
Version
=======
IceHouse on rhel

Description
===========

In order to track network-vif-plugged events across openetsack :
Nova-API send  event network-vif-plugged under AUDIT level ,

" AUDIT nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.server_external_events [req-7bd8ca07-a133-4b57-a6e3-a4340115475d ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] Creating event network-vif-plugged"

Neutron server shos

"INFO neutron.notifiers.nova [-] Nova event response: {u'status': u'completed', u'tag': u'd883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d', u'name': u'network-vif-plugged', u'server_uuid': u'fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca', u'code': 200}
"

BUT nova compute shows  "event network-vif-plugged" only on DEBUG, 
IMHO it should be Info/Audit level as well so we can track that NOVA-API created event to neutron and compute processed that event  

Current  level on compute :
"DEBUG nova.compute.manager [req-7bd8ca07-a133-4b57-a6e3-a4340115475d ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] [instance: fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca] Processing event network-vif-plugged-d883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d _process_instance_event /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py:5665"
title: network-vif-plugged events should be Info on nova compute

comments.content:
Version
=======
IceHouse on rhel

Description
===========

In order to track network-vif-plugged events across openetsack :
Nova-API send  event network-vif-plugged under AUDIT level ,

" AUDIT nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.server_external_events [req-7bd8ca07-a133-4b57-a6e3-a4340115475d ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] Creating event network-vif-plugged"

Neutron server shos

"INFO neutron.notifiers.nova [-] Nova event response: {u'status': u'completed', u'tag': u'd883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d', u'name': u'network-vif-plugged', u'server_uuid': u'fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca', u'code': 200}
"

BUT nova compute shows  "event network-vif-plugged" only on DEBUG, 
IMHO it should be Info/Audit level as well so we can track that NOVA-API created event to neutron and compute processed that event  

Current  level on compute :
"DEBUG nova.compute.manager [req-7bd8ca07-a133-4b57-a6e3-a4340115475d ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] [instance: fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca] Processing event network-vif-plugged-d883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d _process_instance_event /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py:5665"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oblaut

comments.content: I disagree that we should move these out of DEBUG. I actually think we probably need to put more of these down in DEBUG unless there are lost messages, and we should info or warn on those.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Good point about reducing logs.

we need to make sure if event is not received on time all along the path , we will need to warn  it across all components with detailed root cause.

the current messages we have in NOVA-API   about VIF issues, doesn't seems to meet this requirement.

For example :
2014-09-11 05:59:34.748 19069 AUDIT nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.server_external_events [req-7bd8ca07-a133-4b57-a6e3-a4340115475d ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] Creating event network-vif-plugged:d883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d for instance fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca

2014-09-11 06:04:40.061 19062 AUDIT nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.server_external_events [req-b5492a42-d5a6-4b7c-8224-93de6d438811 ca48398ab5f244e3bdfb798f94920fd1 d7e1cf5e67804ef0b8e27329a38105ef] Creating event network-vif-unplugged:d883de4f-9c05-4f49-9125-316708d36d4d for instance fea1a088-212a-4e08-baa5-f745d9bf2cca

The first one doesn't provide information about  if nova  "acked" neutron server plugged the VIF .

The second one doesn't explain why the vif was unplugged , is it neutron ? compute ?  
in case we need to track the issue in scale setup, we need to move to debug.

It will be great, of the messages will give more information about what was the root cause to  unplugged the VIF
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oblaut
